text: The Party for Democratic Action or Democratic Action Party (, PVD; , PDD) is an ethnic Albanian minority political party in Serbia. Its current leader is Shaip Kamberi. At the latest legislative election in 2016, the party received one seat in parliament, a drop from its peak of two seats in 2014. It raised to 3 seats in 2020, following a campaign by Albania's foreign service to increase the political participation of Albanians from the Presevo Valley in Serbia's political elections.Albania daily newspunetejashtme ==Parliamentary representation== {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |+ National Assembly ! rowspan=2| Election ! rowspan=2| Leader ! colspan=2| Votes ! colspan=2| Seats ! rowspan=2| Role |- ! style="width:50px"| # ! style="width:50px"| % ! style="width:50px"| # ! style="width:50px"| ± |- ! 2014 | Riza Halimi | 24,301 | 0.68 | style="text-align:right;"| | | |- ! 2016 | Riza Halimi | 16,262 | 0.43 | style="text-align:right;"| | 1 | |- ! 2020 | Shaip Kamberi | 26,437 | 0.82 | style="text-align:right;"| | 2 | |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1990 establishments in Serbia Category:Political parties of minorities in Serbia Category:Albanians in Serbia Category:Pro-European political parties in Serbia
title: Party for Democratic Action
